t: Luke 18
And*p he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;
Saying,*p There*r was*r in*r a*r city*r a*r judge,*r which*r feared*r not*r God,*r neither*r regarded*r man:*r
And*rp there*r was*r a*r widow*r in*r that*r city;*r and*r she*r came*r unto*r him,*r saying,*r Avenge*r me*r of*r mine*r adversary.*r
And*rp he*r would*r not*r for*r a*r while:*r but*r afterward*r he*r said*r within*r himself,*r Though*r I*r fear*r not*r God,*r nor*r regard*r man;*r
Yet*rp because*r this*r widow*r troubleth*r me,*r I*r will*r avenge*r her,*r lest*r by*r her*r continual*r coming*r she*r weary*r me.*r
And*p the Lord said, Hear*r what*r the*r unjust*r judge*r saith.*r
And*rp shall*r not*r God*r avenge*r his*r own*r elect,*r which*r cry*r day*r and*r night*r unto*r him,*r though*r he*r bear*r long*r with*r them?*r
I*rp tell*r you*r that*r he*r will*r avenge*r them*r speedily.*r Nevertheless*r when*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r cometh,*r shall*r he*r find*r faith*r on*r the*r earth?*r
And*p he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:
Two*rp men*r went*r up*r into*r the*r temple*r to*r pray;*r the*r one*r a*r Pharisee,*r and*r the*r other*r a*r publican.*r

The*rp Pharisee*r stood*r and*r prayed*r thus*r with*r himself,*r God,*r I*r thank*r thee,*r that*r I*r am*r not*r as*r other*r men*r are,*r extortioners,*r unjust,*r adulterers,*r or*r even*r as*r this*r publican.*r
I*rp fast*r twice*r in*r the*r week,*r I*r give*r tithes*r of*r all*r that*r I*r possess.*r

And*rp the*r publican,*r standing*r afar*r off,*r would*r not*r lift*r up*r so*r much*r as*r his*r eyes*r unto*r heaven,*r but*r smote*r upon*r his*r breast,*r saying,*r God*r be*r merciful*r to*r me*r a*r sinner.*r

I*rp tell*r you,*r this*r man*r went*r down*r to*r his*r house*r justified*r rather*r than*r the*r other:*r for*r every*r one*r that*r exalteth*r himself*r shall*r be*r abased;*r and*r he*r that*r humbleth*r himself*r shall*r be*r exalted.*r
And*p they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
But*p Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer*r little*r children*r to*r come*r unto*r me,*r and*r forbid*r them*r not:*r for*r of*r such*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Whosoever*r shall*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r as*r a*r little*r child*r shall*r in*r no*r wise*r enter*r therein.*r
And*p a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
And*p Jesus said unto him, Why*r callest*r thou*r me*r good?*r none*r is*r good,*r save*r one,*r that*r is,*r God.*r
Thou*rp knowest*r the*r commandments,*r Do*r not*r commit*r adultery,*r Do*r not*r kill,*r Do*r not*r steal,*r Do*r not*r bear*r false*r witness,*r Honour*r thy*r father*r and*r thy*r mother.*r
And*p he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

Now*p when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet*r lackest*r thou*r one*r thing:*r sell*r all*r that*r thou*r hast,*r and*r distribute*r unto*r the*r poor,*r and*r thou*r shalt*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven:*r and*r come,*r follow*r me.*r
And*p when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.
And*p when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How*r hardly*r shall*r they*r that*r have*r riches*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
For*rp it*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r a*r needle's*r eye,*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r man*r to*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?
And*p he said, The*r things*r which*r are*r impossible*r with*r men*r are*r possible*r with*r God.*r
Then*p Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

And*p he said unto them, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r There*r is*r no*r man*r that*r hath*r left*r house,*r or*r parents,*r or*r brethren,*r or*r wife,*r or*r children,*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God's*r sake,*r
Who*rp shall*r not*r receive*r manifold*r more*r in*r this*r present*r time,*r and*r in*r the*r world*r to*r come*r life*r everlasting.*r

Then*p he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold,*r we*r go*r up*r to*r Jerusalem,*r and*r all*r things*r that*r are*r written*r by*r the*r prophets*r concerning*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r be*r accomplished.*r
For*rp he*r shall*r be*r delivered*r unto*r the*r Gentiles,*r and*r shall*r be*r mocked,*r and*r spitefully*r entreated,*r and*r spitted*r on:*r
And*rp they*r shall*r scourge*r him,*r and*r put*r him*r to*r death:*r and*r the*r third*r day*r he*r shall*r rise*r again.*r
And*p they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
And*p it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:
And*p hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.
And*p they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
And*p he cried, saying, Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
And*p they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
And*p Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
Saying,*p What*r wilt*r thou*r that*r I*r shall*r do*r unto*r thee?*r And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Receive*r thy*r sight:*r thy*r faith*r hath*r saved*r thee.*r
And*p immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.
